statements.name: PROC TSRECONCILE
statements.description: The TSRECONCILE procedure reconciles forecasts of timestamped data at two different levels of a hierarchy in a top-down fashion for input data that are contained in CAS tables. † When data are organized in a hierarchical fashion, there are often accounting constraints that link the data at different levels of the hierarchy. Typically, for any particular time period, the data in a parent node are either the sum or the average of the data of its child nodes. For example, the total sales of a product by a retail company are the sum of the sales of the same product in all its stores.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: Specifies the input data table that contains the forecast of the time series that represent the children nodes in the hierarchy. Typically, the CHILD= data table is generated by an OUTFOR= data collector object of the TSMODEL procedure. The dimensions of the CHILD= data table are greater than the dimensions of the PARENT= data table. CAS-libref.data-table is a two-level name, where CAS-libref refers to the caslib and session identifier, and data-table specifies the name of the input data table.

arguments.name: OUTFOR=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of the output data table in which to store the reconciled values. CAS-libref.data-table is a two-level name, where CAS-libref refers to the caslib and session identifier, and data-table specifies the name of the input data table.

arguments.name: PARENT=
arguments.description: Specifies the input data table that contains the forecasts of the time series that represent the parent nodes in the hierarchy. Typically, the PARENT= data table is generated by an OUTFOR= data collector object of the TSMODEL procedure. CAS-libref.data-table is a two-level name, where CAS-libref refers to the caslib and session identifier, and data-table specifies the name of the input data table.

arguments.name: AGGREGATE=
arguments.description: Specifies whether the dependent variable in the PARENT= data table is the total sum or the average over the BY groups of the dependent variable in the CHILD= data table. By default, AGGREGATE=SUM.

arguments.name: SUM
arguments.description: Specifies that the dependent variable in the PARENT= data table is a total sum.

arguments.name: AVERAGE
arguments.description: Specifies that the dependent variable in the PARENT= data table is an avarage.

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: Specifies the level of the confidence limits when CLMETHOD=GAUSSIAN, where α must be between 0.0001 and 0.9999. The upper and lower confidence limits will have a 1 - α confidence level. By default, ALPHA=0.05, which produces 95% confidence intervals.

arguments.name: CLMETHOD=
arguments.description: Specifies which method to use to compute confidence limits for the reconciled forecasts.

arguments.name: SHIFT
arguments.description: Computes the confidence intervals by re-centering the original confidence intervals around the new forecasts.

arguments.name: GAUSSIAN
arguments.description: Computes the confidence intervals by assuming that the forecasts are approximately Gaussian.

arguments.name: DISAGGREGATION=
arguments.description: Specifies the type of disaggregation method and type of loss function for top-down reconciliation.

arguments.name: DIFFERENCE
arguments.description: Bases the loss function on the root mean squared error (RMSE), which results in adjustments that are the (possibly weighted) mean difference of the aggregated child nodes and the parent node.

arguments.name: PROPORTIONS
arguments.description: Uses a loss function that results in reconciled forecasts that are the (possibly weighted) proportional disaggregation of the parent node.

arguments.name: LOCKZERO
arguments.description: Specifies that a value of 0 for the Predict variable in the CHILD= data table implies a value of 0 for the corresponding observation in the OUTFOR= data table.

arguments.name: SIGN=
arguments.description: Specifies the sign in the reconciled series. By default, SIGN=MIXED.

arguments.name: MIXED
arguments.description: Specifies that the output series can have any sign.

arguments.name: POSITIVE
arguments.description: Specify that the output series is nonnegative.

arguments.name: NEGATIVE
arguments.description: Specifies that the output series is nonpositive.

arguments.name: WEIGHTED
arguments.description: Weights the loss function for top-down reconciliation by the inverse of the variance of the input forecasts.

statements.name: BY
statements.description: The BY statement defines separate groups of observations for the CHILD= data table. BY variables can be either character or numeric.

statements.name: CHILDROLES
statements.description: The CHILDROLES statement enables you to specify names for forecasting variables in the CHILD= data table.

arguments.name: ACTUAL=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of the variable in theCHILD= data table that contains the actual values. By default, ACTUAL=ACTUAL.

arguments.name: ERROR=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of the variable in the CHILD= data table that contains the error values. By default, ERROR=ERROR.

arguments.name: LOWER=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of the variable in the CHILD= data table that contains the lower confidence limit values. By default, LOWER=LOWER.

arguments.name: PREDICT=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of the variable in the CHILD= data table that contains the predicted values. By default, PREDICT=PREDICT.

arguments.name: STD=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of the variable in the CHILD= data table that contains the standard error values. By default, STD=STD.

arguments.name: UPPER=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of the variable in the CHILD= data table that contains the upper confidence limit values. By default, UPPER=UPPER.

statements.name: ID
statements.description: The ID statement names a numeric variable that identifies observations in the input and output data tables. The ID variable’s values are assumed to be SAS date, time, or datetime values.

arguments.name: END=
arguments.description: Specifies a SAS date, datetime, or time value that represents the date at which the reconciliation ends. If the largest variable value is less than the END= value, this option has no effect.

arguments.name: START=
arguments.description: Specifies a SAS date, datetime, or time value that represents the variable value at which the reconciliation begins. This option can be used to limit the reconciliation process only to forecasts that are outside the historical period.

statements.name: PARENTROLES
statements.description: The PARENTROLES statement enables you to specify custom names for forecasting variables in the PARENT= data table.

arguments.name: ACTUAL=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of the variable in the PARENT= data table that contains the actual values. By default, ACTUAL=ACTUAL.

arguments.name: ERROR=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of the variable in the PARENT= data table that contains the error values. By default, ERROR=ERROR.

arguments.name: LOWER=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of the variable in the PARENT= data table that contains the lower confidence limit values. By default, LOWER=LOWER.

arguments.name: PREDICT=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of the variable in the CHILD= data table that contains the predicted values. By default, PREDICT=PREDICT.

arguments.name: STD=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of the variable in the PARENT= data table that contains the standard error values. By default, STD=STD.

arguments.name: UPPER=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of the variable in the PARENT= data table that contains the upper confidence limit values. By default, UPPER=UPPER.
